Even to serve us 2am morning a cup of tea and give us opinions and suggestions for the day planning it was very nice of him. Sorry but I can not remember your name to thank you personally. And personal thank you to Maria, our angel who took care of us on mornings with her charming Spanish/English and warm smile. I would recommend that hotel to anyone who wants to have personal warm service and attention with offered stylish comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay at Petit Palace Museum”
Reviews.Author: screen00
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for Christmas. Excellent location, blocks away from everything you want to see. Simple to get to/from BCN, take the Blue bus from the airport to Plaza Catalunya (last stop) and walk about two blocks up and over (will take you 5-10 min). Buy the return ticket for about 7 Euros from the driver. The ticket machine at the airport bus stop requires exact change so just buy from driver (like everyone else). If you need to get oriented at the bus stop just ask the driver. We also had a map. So simple and cheaper than a taxi. Also there are Metro stops right around the corner. Room was not as big as those shown in some of the pictures. Probably a little bit bigger than the avg Euro hotel room but well planned. High ceilings. Clean and comfortable. Bathroom was nice and shower was excellent. Walk-in shower! No need to pole vault into the tub here as you do with most showers in Europe. Excellent water pressure and temperature. Other reviews suggest this may have been a problem in the past. In my travels, I have experienced a variance in water pressure/temp depending on when I shower and try to avoid peak shower times (as you would in a private home). I did notice that on the water on/off, is like a kitchen faucet, left/right=temp, out/up controls the pressure. I just mention it as my husband didn't know at first how to control the pressure. There's a frosted decal on the glass bathroom door now (or was in our room) for privacy. Looks like they responded to feedback. Thought that the snakeskin pattern tile in the bathroom was a neat ode to Gaudi as well as the picture on the bathroom door decal. Loved having a laptop with internet access in the room. Even with our guidebooks we found ourselves looking stuff up at the last minute. A-plus addition to the hotel experience. Didn't eat at the hotel but they did have room service and a restaurant. There's a little space in the mini-fridge for your water etc. Didn't use the phone. Didn't ask for help, but the front desk staff seemed happy and helpful and spoke English, and were patient with our poor Spanish. Cleaning staff was very nice and did a great job. Ordered a wake-up call which came at the proper time. They did have a clock/radio with alarm but I unplugged as the buttons are somewhat lit and the light bothered me. Strange how sensitive to light I can be when everything is dark. There were other people staying at the hotel but we never heard our neighbors. They either have excellent sound proofing or spaced us out considerably. I saw people in the lobby and on the elevator and even on our floor but didn't hear anyone within the room. Room was a bit warm (even after we monkeyed with temp control), we opened the window. You hear the occasional street noise or noise from people on the terraces but nothing that kept me up (I'm a light sleeper). Bed was clean and comfortable. On the firm side. Linens are very good quality, soft. Extra pillow in the cupboard/closet. No luggage rack. There's room on top of the cupboard for luggage but no collapsible luggage rack to put your bag on while unpacking. We used the chair to pack/unpack. No coffee/tea tray in room but Starbucks was open on Christmas morning! Excellent place to stay. We're fairly picky. We will stay here again and will checkout the other High Tech Hotels. Can't say enough nice things about our stay. You get full value and beyond for your money. Don't write reviews but felt compelled to do so about this place. Last 2 hotels we stayed in and liked: Sofitel St James in London, Hotel de Vendome in Paris. Also, on Christmas lots of restaurants around were open this year.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: levearne
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the hotel, it was as described on the website but perhaps the bedroom could have been bigger. We requested and got a balcony, which had views over the main street. The room was warm despite the freezing temperatures outside. We did not use the restaurant or had breakfast so we cannot comment on the food. Whilst the hotel was nice, we had a very poor experience at the El Raco restaurant around the corner, the staff spoke no English even though the menu was in English, the crepe starter was cold and our well done steak was raw. The chef stormed out and the waitress then turned our steak into charcoal. Avoid at all costs....

Reviews.Title: “Funky boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Staceyu1507
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Petit Palace Museum for our first wedding anniversary at the end of November. My partner had been to Barcelona before and stayed at Barcelona Central which he absolutely raved about. However I really liked the look of this hotel on the website and the reviews were fantastic so we decided to give it a try. I am so glad - this hotel was exactly what I'd had in mind when I intially started looking at Barcelona. The entrance to the hotel is stunning with a wonderful grand piano in the foyer. The reception staff greeted us with warm smiles as we checked in which was a great start as hotel's like this sometimes can be a bit 'standoffish'. The room was lovely. The style of the room is very funky and ultra modern. I was particularly impressed by both this modern sleek style as well as the size of the room. We had a separate dressing area which was wonderfully luxurious for a city centre hotel. The bathroom was to die for. A large enough shower to fit in a whole rugby team - wonderful!! I can not say enough about this hotel. If you are looking for a good value, modern boutique in good location to all barcelona's amenities you must stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique”
Reviews.Author: Chris-Doug
Reviews.Content: The hotel sits just 50 meters from the main drag “La Ramblas”. The façade belies what lies inside. This hotel retains all the elegant architecture of the city but has been sensitively renovated to deliver a tasteful and exciting hotel experience. From the moment that you check in you realize that whoever designed the décor of this place was on a mission to do something just a little bit different whilst still catering to a clientele with many different tastes. The rooms are clean and medium sized but delivers an ambience and style that is absolutely modern Spain. The lighting and use of different surfaces and textures all combine to create a spectacular room that is a delight to be in. The bathroom is just good fun and again although relatively small has everything that is required. The shower has inspired us to renovate our beach house using the same fittings. All rooms come with a Lap top computer hooked up to the net and that is included in the room charge. Large screen TV, a comfortable king size bed, no traffic noise, courteous staff, it all just worked. Our room overlooked the street near La Ramblas and it’s ever changing moods, so each day and evening as we sought another adventure was just down the street. Our experience was positive and we would not hesitate going back to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “What a beautiful hotel !!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sambanini
Reviews.Content: We had looked at all the hotel website's and reviewers' photos, and hoped it would be as good as it looked....and it was better! A beautiful, funky, chic hotel, with free laptop and internet access in the room, mini bar, safe (controlled by resident's credit card rather than the room card - a lot safer!) en suite bathroom with huge hydroshower, and our own balcony (ideal for coffee and croissants for breakfast watching the world go by)! Twin beds as booked, very comfortable. Room was cleaned daily. Only 2 blocks walk from the main square (Placa Catalunya) and La Ramblas (with well known coffee shop on the way!) Would recommend to anyone wishing to stay in an unforgettable hotel, close to the centre of Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Boutique palace”
Reviews.Author: smile4lisa
Reviews.Content: The name caught my attention!! Petit palace museum..how cute and boutique-e i thought! Right at the top of the La Rambla (the main touristy street of Barca) a taxi ride costs about 23euros from Barca Airport. Hotel pictures on the website did not disappoint me and were absolutely accurate! Very chic interior and classy i would say! Paid for a high-tech room which was cool, had a plasma TV, funky IPOD stereo/charger/AMAZING HYDROSHOWER (!!!) and a great balcony view of the busy street. Room was spacious, tho i would highly recommend having a full length mirror in the room, also we booked for a king sized bed...it turned out to be 2 singles put together and the beds parted if you tried to sleep in the middle!! (not ideal for honeymooners!..and not funny if you fell down between the 2 beds in the middle of the night)..also to mention, laptop with free webacess was useful for searching all the opening times of tourist places to go the day before! Didn't go for the breakfast...15Euros per person was a bit steep! Bad points about the hotel: banging/drilling work was done one early morning! not good! Room Card sometimes failed to work...had to keep getting it re-activated! Staff was great help, didn't involve them too much during the stay becuase we was out and about most of the time, but if you do get a cheap deal on this hotel, defo go for it, you won't ever stay in another hotel like this!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: tladder
Reviews.Content: Booked through lastminute.com in August, flew from Manchester, two days before we left! We're both nineteen. We absolutely loved the hotel, perfect location just above Placa de Catelyuna and Las Ramblas. It should be a 5* hotel..rooms are huge..gorgeous..laptop with free internet, lcd tv and mini bar in room..can't stress how perfect this hotel is! Great staff and we would recommend hiring the free bikes to explore Barcelona in a different way! We would return tomorrow if we could!!

Reviews.Title: “Penthouse with yacuzzi!”
Reviews.Author: MBS_08
Reviews.Content: We booked our trip at Lastminute.se and were positively suprised (read: chocked!!) to found out that we got the penthouse with a 50 m2 terrace and outdoor yacuzzi!! What a stay... We started every night with champagne & wine in the water under the open sky. Do I need to mention that the location of the hotel was the best possible with two blocks to Casa Batlló (Gaudi), close to the beach, clubs and placa de Catalunya etc. Cool design of the interiour, nice staff and lots of extras.

Reviews.Title: “Really liked this hotel”
Reviews.Author: adorable08
Reviews.Content: Date: August 4th 2008 The staff at the Hotel were helpful, we had a 22 month old with us whom needed his milk bottles washing everyday & they provided us with warm milk when needed. If we asked, they would give information on sight seeing but options on different travel method was not offered. Theres aircon in the room, the balcony was not very big to enjoy a sit down, food & drink was very expensive in the hotel, my cup of tea was 10euros. The hydro shower was lovely but the shower tray was very slippery for our baby! There was not alot of room from the beds end to the desk where the laptop & tv is set & because the bedframe has sharp edges, it is pretty dangerous for baby. I read a review here on not being able to find the DVD, CD player, well i've worked it out for you, its all in the laptop! :-) There were only 3 english channels, so there was not much to watch, the news was a repeat. Its location is great for shopping & places to eat.

Reviews.Title: “really nice”
Reviews.Author: badbad
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a real surprise for me. Much more than expected from a 4* hotel. I booked a double room + a child and it was huge in size. The room design is very modern and stylish. All rooms are equipped with laptops with free internet and a gacuzi!. They even had free bicycle renting. The location is great,10 min walk to the ramblas, 2 min walk to the shopping street and the metro station. Restaurants are just next doors. Very friendly and experienced staff, they can help with all your tourist questions. The hotel is very child friendly. The breakfast was good. The only complain is that the bathroom had liitle privacy; the door is transparent and unlockable. Should be ok if you don’t have kids. I recommend this hotel for all.

Reviews.Title: “ideal hotel for sightseeing and comfort”
Reviews.Author: go4val
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel from 30th june for 4 days. on arrival the receptionist was welcoming and informative. the hotel is ideally situated for all the sights of barcelona. the rooms are comfortable, and the bathroom was to die for. after a long day sightseeing, the power shower was heaven and so ivigorating. We stayed on a B & B basis, breakfast consisted of cereals, fruit juices, hot and cold selection, toast and jams, and tea or coffee, enough to set you up for a days sightseeing. We found the tourist bus an ideal way of seeing all the sights, you can buy a day or a 2 day ticket, you have commentry on the bus, and you can get on and off at all the attractions you wish to. The buses are very frequent (every 10 min or so ) There is so much to see and do in Barcelona, we are definately going back, and this hotel is an ideal base, being only 5 to 10 min walk from the ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: dreaminofnextholiday
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a few days in June. Nice hotel - very modern room and bathroom with excellent shower. Room had a small balcony also. We overlooked the street, but this wasn't a problem as it was quiet. We did not eat at the hotel as prices were quite steep, but the location was excellent and only a short walk to restaurants and Las Ramblas. The staff on reception spoke very good English and were helpful. The hotel had a bar area, but there was never anyone in it during our stay, so we didn't use it. Barcelona is a lovely city and we would return. The tour buses that cover various routes are a good option for sightseeing - and you can get on and off the bus whenever you like as the ticket is valid for the whole day. There are also two metro stations within a few minutes walk of the hotel. Overall - great city and great hotel - would return.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely but not good value!”
Reviews.Author: MissRandom
Reviews.Content: Generally a nice hotel in a great location but not value for money. It was on average in total £140 per night, not including breakfast. We chose not to have breakfast there as it was 15euro each. The bed was hard and the pillows even harder. The shower was brilliant, as was the location. Staff are friendly but just don't seem to go the extra mile for you. Free internet access via a laptop in the room but no coffee/tea making facilities. Not a great nights sleep due to the comfort of the bed. If you're after a great location and an awesome shower then go for it. If value for money and comfort is what you're after, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “'petit palace' is no palace”
Reviews.Author: maudelynn85
Reviews.Content: much of the staff was terribly rude, many of the "features" were not what they were advertised, for instance the "high tech" features turned into my having to ask for passwords for my internet usage on my personal computer three times. Go elsewhere. This was a buisiness/tourist stay for me, if I had to do it again I would stay in a warmer, more friendly place. The architect had fun designing the place but it isn't like friendly Barcelona at all, and it isn't even comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: Tania_Madrid
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a surprise from the very beginning: great location, next to La Rambla De Cataluña, great design, big open lobby, polite receptionist, great corridor design, big beautiful room (for a single traveler), huge bed. The staff was helpful and very nice, you could even play a piano in the reception (almost like everything's allowed). Very modern design, but comforting at the same time (some of High Tech chain is a little too modern). Great room, very beautiful, huge bed. Big bathroom with jacuzzi bath, equipped with champoo and bath gel, and also a comb, dryer, etc. I did not hear any neighbors, drilling, or whatever I read in other reviews. Absolutely quiet. This hotel is ideal for single travelers, however I imagine it can be good for any business travelers and tourists, for travelers with pets, for couples and honeymooners. Minuses: small wardrobe, the balcony door did not close and nobody cared, neither me, although I informed the reception. Pluses: everything else. I reserved it on the hotel website, paying in total in advance (it was the best price on internet), and I paid 155 euros per night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique you won't regret”
Reviews.Author: spunge411
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in a quad room last week. The decor was as beautiful, in the lobby as it was on each floor and rooms. The staff was helpful, from arranging for a van to pick us up from the airport, reccomendations,...etc. A special thanks to Oscar, Christina, Maria, and Marco. they endured frequent emails from me, and always answered questions in detail. The location is at the top os Las Ramblas, which is really perfect and you can really walk anywhere from here...and the are 2 train stations we used within 5 mins walking distance, they are CATALUNYA and PASSEIG DE GRACIA. All shopping is close by too. We didn't use the hotel breakfast, there are about 5 places for coffee and pastries/eggs within 1 min walk and one block to the left of the hotel is a bar, that never seemed to close :) And if you want to walk a maximum of 5 mins for a great breakfast in a local setting, there is the world famous La Boqueria.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place!”
Reviews.Author: loony44
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last week with my husband, daughter (5) and son (3). I am really fussy when it comes to hotels and holidays and research like crazy. This hotel did not fail to impress! We decided to take a taxi from El Prat airport to the hotel and it took 15 minutes and cost €14 (this was at lunchtime). The taxi pulled up and we were 'wow!'. The hotel is very stylish. Reception staff were very friendly and checked us in quickly and efficiently. We went to our room and it was enormous! We had a family room so had a double bed plus bunkbeds. The kids loved the bunk beds as they had their own little tv sets with cartoons. Our room had 2 large wardrobes, a minibar, safe (free), large TV and laptop with free fast internet access. The bathroom was also very big and had a stylish handbasin, hairdryer, toilet and large bath with hydroshower. The water was piping hot and very powerful and was an absolute joy. There was a step to help people get in and out of the bath and plenty of places to put your soap and shower gel. The breakfast would have cost us €16 per person per day but we found a lovely Spanish cafe just 1 minute away (La Tramoia) where we ate and it only cost a TOTAL of €14 ( we had juice, coffee, toast and croissants for 4 people). The hotel is in a great location - only 2 blocks from Placa Catalunya and the top of La Rambla. It took only 5 minutes to walk here. The Placa Catalunya is where the tourist bus starts and we took a 2 day ticket on this and used this as our transport in Barcelona. It took us everywhere we wanted to go and we just got off and on at each place. The kids loved it, too, especially sitting upstairs on the opentop and enjoying the warm sunshine. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. It was stylish, quiet, great location, friendly helpful staff. The negative points that people have mentioned in previous reviews have all been taken care of by the hotel ( I presume they read this and take note?). The water was hot and powerful, there was a step and rail to get in shower/bath, the elevator didn't creak, the lobby was all one level so no little bits to trip over. Will definitely be staying here if we ever return to Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “I will be back”
Reviews.Author: eischen
Reviews.Content: Have been here for one night and it has been very good. The room has been outstanding. Clearly above average. Large. All amenities available. Including WiFi for free. Contrary to other contributions I found the staff very kind and helpfull. Always a smile. And that helps sometimes a lot. The Lobby was Ok and very design. Breakfast buffet was sufficient and all you could wish for. Location is pefect. Close to Placa de Cataluna and at some distance of the other purely touristic places. A good starting point. Will defenitely go back. This is a chain hotel. Have also gone to BCN Hotel which was less amazing. Saw one in the old town with same style which I might try next time.

Reviews.Title: “Undiscovered Gem!”
Reviews.Author: visitar
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a wonderful surprise for my family and me. We booked a room there because we could put all 4 members of my family (two adults, two teens) in one family room. This is really hard to find in Spain without resorting to renting an apartment. When we arrived, we were so pleased to find out that they had upgraded us to a junior suite upon discovering that it was my husband's birthday on our check-in date. Our room had a 6-person hot tub and a huge, walk-in shower. The hotel was sleek and had a trendy boutique feel. We had plenty of room to spread out and wished we were staying longer instead of leaving for Madrid the next day. The hotel is located in a nice part of town, but is not near Las Ramblas, if that is what you are looking for. It was fairly quiet. When our son did something (!) to the toilet and caused it to run constantly, they sent up a maintenance person and had it fixed within the hour. The front desk personnel were friendly, welcoming and helpful. I would absolutely recommend this hotel to any traveller. Great value for the price - and a fun, funky place!
